description: This advanced course rotates between various topics in film that may include genres and styles,
authorship, national and transnational cinemas, industrial history, and film's relationship to
other art forms and popular culture at large.  Students study films within a context that
emphasizes specialized theoretical, cultural, or historical concerns and questions.  May be
repeated if topic is different. Offered
annually in the spring semester.  Prerequisite: FMS 101.
fullname: Topics in Film and Media Studies
